text: ⓘ From 2019 and earlier, PHO/1 papers contained Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) in Section A, rather than Short Answer Questions (SAQs).
ⓘ These are not available to the public, so this paper only contains Section B (Essays).
Section B contains essay questions and carries 50% of the total marks for the examination.
You have 3 hours (plus any pre-agreed individual adjustment) to answer this paper. You must complete this paper within this time-period.

sub-instructions: ⓘ Answer TWO of the following essay questions, with a maximum of one from questions B1a and B1b.
content: What adaptations allow plants to survive fluctuations in the availability of soil nutrients?
What adaptations allow animals to survive fluctuations in the availability of their principal energy source?
How do animals and plants detect and respond to rhythmical changes in the environment?
Discuss the diverse implications of Laplace's law for the 'design' of organisms.
What mechanisms allow water loss to be minimised while organisms carry out essential gas exchange with air?
What mechanisms do animals and plants use to produce rapid movements?
